results.title: Stunts: fights and falls
results.creator_credit: Tony De Zarraga and Tim Barr
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Like good athletes, stuntmen must warm up before attempting any feats. Control and practice are of paramount importance. For realism rehearsal in the front of a camera and the matching of the movements of the actor and stuntman are essential. The narrator Jack Mohoney, as well as giving the historical background to stunts in films gives many hints on safety and training.

results.title: Effective Resumes and Job Applications
results.creator_credit: Louise Welsh Schrank, Stage Fright Productions and Learning Seed
results.brief_description: Learn how to handle job applications and resumes so that you don’t make mistakes that could cost you jobs and money. Let this video show you how to handle resumes, cover letters, and job applications. In today’s competitive job market, this video gives straightforward advice you will appreciate.

results.title: Edward Scissorhands (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lonely old inventor in a castle upon a hill dies and leaves his greatest creation, a boy called Edward, unfinished. Instead of hands, the boy has sharp shears of metal. Until his rescue by a kindly Avon lady who takes him home to the pastel paradise of suburbia, Edward lives alone in darkness. “Edward Scissorhands” is more than a fairy tale by masterful director Tim Burton. This is a satire/allegory which is both funny and moving. Johhny Depp as Edward is a gentle creature full of pathos, yet dignified; much less a monster than the fickle humans who at first embrace him and then seek to destroy him. Dianne Weist stars as Avon Lady Peg, and Winona Ryder as her daughter, Kim. The sets are typical of Burton’s famed surreal style. “Edward Scissorhands” is a film of great poignancy with its own special beauty.

results.title: Make-up: aging and hair
results.creator_credit: Tony De Zarraga and Tim Barr
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Beau Hickman, of “Spartacus” and “The Ten commandments” fame, demonstrates basic makeup techniques that easily fall into everyone’s budget. Using a variety of materials, the student learns the techniques of the aging process and the application of beards and moustaches, black eyes, skin tones and built-up noses.

results.title: Ed TV
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: Ed TV explores fame through the Big Brother phenomenon where ordinary people become famous just by allowing the nation to watch them 24/7. Ed (Matthew McConaughey) is chosen to be the star of the lastest real TV program. He agrees to allow cameras to film him 24 hours a day and broadcast this across the nation. After a shakey start the program takes off and Ed becomes the latest big thing. He initially enjoys his fame. But he starts to rethink his decision when the intrusive cameras potentially cause him to loose his new found love Shari(Jenna Elfman) and destory his family.

results.title: Education: where do we go from here?
results.creator_credit: Ron Rowe and Rowe and Co Communications
results.brief_description: A wide variety of education academics, administrators politicians and teacher-union leaders talk about the increasing irrelevance of education systems. Those interviewed include Barry Jones, Dr. Lawrie Shears, Dr. Ken Mckinnon and Professor Headley Beare.

results.title: Edouard et Caroline = Edward and Caroline
results.creator_credit: Jacques Becker, Raymond Borderie and Robert Bossis
results.brief_description:
A young married couple quarrel on the eve of a party that can make or break the spouse’s career as a pianist.

Credits: Producer, Robert Bossis, Raymond Borderie ; director, Jacques Becker ; writers, Annette Wademant, Jacques Becker ; photography, Robert Le Febvre ; music, Jean-Jacques Grunenwald ; editor, Marguerite Renoir ; assistant director, Marcel Camus ;
Cast: Anne Vernon, Daniel Gelin, Jacques Francois, Elina Labourdette, Betty Stockfeld, Jean Riveyre.

results.title: Eclair. Episode 09
results.creator_credit: Pat McLagan, Alma Gray, David Ash and ILEA
results.brief_description: The series “Eclair” features Ted, a rather confused and naive Englishman and a pair of mischievous French adolescent twins. The theme in this film is: “Food and drink - a picnic” using a picnic to introduce the viewer to the names of a range of food, food packaging and French shop names.
